DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Assessment Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total score on the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) for healthy children and adolescents, computed from four scales, and 23 total items. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Assessment Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (pee-dee-AT-rik) Having to do with children._A generic concept reflecting concern with the modification and enhancement of life attributes, e.g., physical, political, moral and social environment; the overall condition of a human life._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with children.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
